questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
Your company uses Microsoft Teams Calling Plans.
The company acquires a small development team. Currently, users on the team have their own direct inward dial (DID) numbers that have PSTN capabilities.
You migrate the users to Teams.
You need to ensure that you have phone numbers that you can assign to the users.
Solution: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, you create a new port order.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
port order to transfers the numbers is good

1. Assign numberes to emergency addresses
2. Acquire numbers for new Teams users 
OR 
Move numbers from Calling Plans to Operator Connect 
OR 
Move numbers from Direct Routing to Operator Connect
3. Assign numbers

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/operator-connect-configure

To me it makes more sense to get the numbers first, keep in mind if you create an Emergency address without ELIN phone number and then you need to add it later on you won't be able to do so and will be forced to create a new address
I think Emergency Adress should be first, because number range selection will be based on the physical location address or area code.
I think Emergency Adress should be first, otherwise you will not be able to send a phonenumber via API for Operator Connect

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
From Voice in the Microsoft Teams admin center, you add an Operator Connect.
You need to enable users for Microsoft Teams Phone.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Be mindful it could change to use:
Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment -Identity <user>  -PhoneNumber <phone number> -PhoneNumberType OperatorConnect
...Instead of Set-CSOnlineVoiceUser, as this is the long term replacement cmdlet.

Selected Answer: BCD
"OnPremLineURI parameter- A&F... are not applicable in this scenario as Operator Connect uses cloud-based voice routing, not on-premises voice routing. go with B,C,D

comments.content: But you are starting with Direct Routing, so you need to remove OnPremLineURI and VoiceRoutingPolicy first, then set the phone number back up using CsOnlineVoiceUser to move them to Operator Connect.

discussion.content: Set-CsUser is not working anymore, in my opinion this question is outdated.
Answer is correct. steps are mentioned here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/operator-connect-mobile-configure#remove-the-online-voice-routing-policy-associated-with-your-user

choices.F: Run the Set-CsUser cmdlet and set the ג€"OnPremLineURI parameter to each user's phone number.
choices.C: Run the Grant-CsOnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy cmdlet and set the ג€"Policyname parameter to $null.
choices.A: Run the Set-CsUser cmdlet and set the ג€"OnPremLineURI parameter to $null.
choices.B: Run the Grant-CsOnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy cmdlet and set the ג€"Policyname parameter to Policy1.
choices.D: Run the Set-CsOnlineVoiceUser cmdlet and set the ג€"TelephoneNumber parameter to each user's phone number.
choices.E: Run the Set-CsOnlineVoiceUser cmdlet and set the ג€"TelephoneNumber parameter to $null.

questions.question_text:
Your company receives PSTN services in Microsoft Teams through a derived Direct Routing trunk from a telephone carrier.
The carrier becomes an operator in the Operator Connect program.
You need to migrate the users to Operator Connect.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: wrong answer, i follow Gabriel, Set-Csuser is not working anymore in the latest teams powershell module. I think it shoud be A & B
Set-csuer is required to enable enterprisevoice even for direct routing

I might agree with gabriel2ro,
the Set-CsUser cmdlet seems to be used to ensure the user is homed online, which only applies to applies to Skype for Business Server Enterprise Voice enabled users being migrated to Teams Direct Routing.
Since there is no mention of migration from Skype for Business to Teams Direct Routing, I think option E is unnecessary.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-enable-users

Another note is that Set-CsOnlineVoiceUser may have been replaced with Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment in the documentation.
Not sure if the Exam questions may have been updated.
Set-CSUser is for onprem AD. Shouldn't be B instead of E : Set-CsOnline-User

questions.question_text:
You are enabling users for Direct Routing.
You already assigned licenses to the users.
You need to complete the user setup.
Which two cmdlets should you run? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: A and C. HDMI ingestion has been a long awaited feature which is now GA for TRS.
Does Surface Hub 2S not also meet these requirements? It includes HDMI in which can be then shared into a Teams meeting

comments.content: Update: Just had this question on the exam and the Surface Hub 2S option was not included

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.
You are designing a room that will be used for collaboration.
You need to select a device for the room. The device must meet the following requirements:
✑ Support video.
✑ Support one-touch join for meetings.
✑ Can start new meetings from within the room.
✑ Support HDMI ingestion of content into Teams.
Which type of device should you select? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
